p: The XRD patterns of the as-cast rods with a diameter of 10 mm of various BT X alloys are shown in Fig. 4i. As x ≤ 0.15, no crystalline diffraction peaks were detected in the 10 mm rod of BT15, indicating a fully amorphous structure. Weak reflections of β-Ti begin to become detectable in the 10 mm rod of BT20 and its intensities increase with increasing X. This suggests an increasing volume fraction of β-Ti. These results are corroborated by TEM micrographs ( Supplementary Fig. 3), which prove the fully glassy nature of the BT15 rod with a diameter of 10 mm and in the ϕ10 mm rod of BT20 TEM reveals the presence of small β-Ti dendrites.
